poem:
### Conquest

In the cradle of sand, an ancient cry—  
Land scorched by the sun, sky torched by dreams  
Of borders redrawn where shadows lie,  
Hushed prayers echo through silent streams.  
Footprints stained in shifting clay,  
A people moved, like ancient waves,  
While conquest paints the night in gray,  
The heart of the world trembles and braves.
